page.title: 02TRANSPORT IN THE AREA
page.content: There is, in 1985, a twice weekly bus service on Tuesday and Thursday mornings which goes through Butleigh and Baltonsborough to Street and Glastonbury allowing roughly two hours for shopping. As this is the only public transport, people without cars are restricted in their movements. If you wanted to go to London by train you would have to go to Castle Cary, about ten miles away across country. If you wanted to go anywhere else by train you would have to go to Bristol or Bath, both about twenty eight miles away. There are two Taxi services in Butleigh and one in Baltonsborough. Baltonsborough has a Black Book where someone who was going to Street, for example, would ring up and offer a lift to someone who hasn't got a car.
